summaryText: Wow! What an incredible sermon about the spiritual law of the harvest from Pastor Travis Hearn! PT delivered a powerful message about sowing seeds and reaping God's blessings. Can you imagine that everything in life starts as a seed - every dream, every business, every miracle? The most mind-blowing part is that God is waiting for US to plant our seeds, not the other way around! Pastor Travis broke down five incredible facts about the law of the harvest that will revolutionize how you think about giving and faith. He shared powerful personal stories, like recovering from a stroke by sowing seeds of health, and challenged the church to do something radical for God's kingdom. The most compelling moment was when he shared how God challenged him to give $100,000 - and then miraculously provided the resources! This sermon isn't just about money, it's about radical faith and trusting God to multiply what you're willing to plant. Whether it's finances, health, relationships, or spiritual growth, PT reminded us that you grow exactly what you sow. Are you ready to plant some radical seeds?
mainPoints: You grow exactly what you sow
The more you sow, the more you grow

versesMentioned.text: I tell you the truth, unless a kernel of wheat is planted in the soil and dies, it remains alone. But its death will produce many new kernels and a plentiful harvest of new lives.

He also said, 'This is what the kingdom of God is like. A man scatters seed on the ground. Night and day, whether he sleeps or gets up, the seed sprouts and grows, though he does not know how. All by itself the soil produces grain—first the stalk, then the head, then the full kernel in the head. As soon as the grain is ripe, he puts the sickle to it, because the harvest has come.'
In the same way, faith by itself, if it is not accompanied by action, is dead.
One person gives freely, yet gains even more; another withholds unduly, but comes to poverty. A generous person will prosper; whoever refreshes others will be refreshed.

Do not be deceived: God cannot be mocked. A man reaps what he sows. Whoever sows to please their flesh, from the flesh will reap destruction; whoever sows to please the Spirit, from the Spirit will reap eternal life.

Remember this: Whoever sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and whoever sows generously will also reap generously. Each of you should give what you have decided in your heart to give, not reluctantly or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver.
Give, and it will be given to you. A good measure, pressed down, shaken together and running over, will be poured into your lap. For with the measure you use, it will be measured to you.

'Truly I tell you,' Jesus replied, 'no one who has left home or brothers or sisters or mother or father or children or fields for me and the gospel will fail to receive a hundred times as much in this present age: homes, brothers, sisters, mothers, children and fields—along with persecutions—and in the age to come, eternal life.'

Monday.scripture: Philippians 4:19: 'And my God will meet all your needs according to the riches of his glory in Christ Jesus.'
Monday.focus: Identifying areas in life where I need to sow seeds
Monday.action: Make a list of 3 areas in your life where you want to see growth. Next to each area, write down a specific way you can 'sow a seed' this week.
Monday.prayer: Lord, show me where I need to plant seeds of faith. Help me trust You with my needs and guide me in sowing generously. Reveal to me the areas where I can trust You more deeply. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Proverbs 3:9-10: 'Honor the Lord with your wealth, with the firstfruits of all your crops; then your barns will be filled to overflowing, and your vats will brim over with new wine.'
Tuesday.focus: Understanding the principle of first fruits
Tuesday.action: Evaluate your giving habits. Are you giving God your 'first fruits' or your leftovers? Consider how you might prioritize giving in your budget.
Tuesday.prayer: God, help me honor You with my resources. Show me how to be a faithful steward and give generously from a heart of love and obedience. Reveal any areas of selfishness in my giving. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 9:10: 'Now he who supplies seed to the sower and bread for food will also supply and increase your store of seed and will enlarge the harvest of your righteousness.'
Wednesday.focus: Recognizing God as the source of all provision
Wednesday.action: Spend time journaling about times God has provided for you in unexpected ways. Write a gratitude list focusing on His faithfulness.
Wednesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, thank You for being my ultimate provider. Help me trust in Your provision and not rely solely on my own efforts. Increase my faith and show me how to be a generous sower. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Malachi 3:10: 'Bring the whole tithe into the storehouse, that there may be food in my house. Test me in this,' says the Lord Almighty, 'and see if I will not throw open the floodgates of heaven and pour out so much blessing that there will not be room enough to store it.'
Thursday.focus: Challenging yourself to trust God with your finances
Thursday.action: Consider taking the 90-day tithing challenge. If you already tithe, pray about giving an additional offering or supporting a specific ministry.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, I want to trust You completely with my finances. Give me courage to step out in faith and test Your promises. Help me overcome any fear or doubt about giving. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Galatians 6:9: 'Let us not become weary in doing good, for at the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up.'
Friday.action: Identify an area where you've been discouraged or tempted to give up. Recommit to sowing seeds of faith in that area.
Friday.prayer: God, renew my strength and hope. Help me stay consistent in doing good, even when I don't see immediate results. Give me patience and perseverance. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Luke 6:38: 'Give, and it will be given to you. A good measure, pressed down, shaken together and running over, will be poured into your lap.'
Saturday.action: Look for an unexpected opportunity to bless someone this week. Give without expecting anything in return.
Saturday.prayer: Father, make me a conduit of Your blessing. Help me see opportunities to give and serve others. May my life reflect Your generosity and love. Amen.
